title: chore: upgrade yaml version and fix docs
body:
# Changes

 * Upgrade `serde_yaml` to latest.
 * Fix yaml / msgpack docs mixup.
 * Fix features not showing on docs.rs.
 * Fix docs.rs feature warning being missing.

title: chore: version bump for new msgpack version
body:
# Changes

 * Version bump for msgpack.
 * Change to test msgpack along side other features.
 * Add links to msgpack and yaml information in readme.

# Comments

Big thanks to @pitbuster for adding support!

title: feat: add MsgPack support
body:
# Changes

 * Adds support for sending, receiving and asserting [MsgPack](https://msgpack.org/) content

# Comments

Support is behind the `msgpack` flag. I didn't bump the crate version, but if it needed I am happy to do it.

title: chore: bump version
body:
# Changes

 * Minor version bump for release.

title: Small improvement to fail fast docs
body: When I first read this, I was a bit confused about the wording here, so trying to slightly improve it.

title: feat: add Yaml support
body:
# Changes

 * Add Yaml support for sending, receiving, and asserting.

# Comments

Yaml support is behind the `yaml` feature flag.

title: docs: add more documentation on multipart form and parts
body:
# Changes

 * Add documentation for `multipart::MultipartForm` and `multipart::Part`.

title: fix: docs link in crates io
body:
# Changes

 * Fix link on crates io to docs

title: chore: remove unused rand dependency
body:
# Changes

 * remove unused dependency.

title: feat: multipart support
body:
# Changes

 * add `TestRequest::multipart`

This adds multipart form support.

title: chore: update dependencies to latest
body:
# Changes

 * Update to the latest dependencies.

# Comments

I'm releasing this as a minor bump, as there are minor bumps in dependencies.

title: chore: Axum 7 upgrade
body:
# Changes

 * Update to Axum 0.7, Hyper 1.0, and HTTP 1.0.
 * Fix breaking changes for update.
 * Add compatibility table to readme.

# Comments

This was much easier than I was expecting.

title: fix: upstream port reserving bug
body:
# Changes

 * Upgrade the port reserve crate to the latest version, to fix IP reservation bug.

# Comments

The reserve-port crate is using an unspecified IP, and Axum Test is using Localhost. This can cause a port to be offered which isn't available.

title: chore: bump dependencies
body:
# Changes

 * Update all dependencies to latest (except Hyper and HTTP)

title: Feat request format tidyup
body:
# Changes

 * Move Method + path information into common `RequestPathFormatter` .
 * Update `TestRequest` errors to include the requested path.

# Comments

This is a continuing refactor to make all of the error messages similar and use the same common information across the board.

title: fix a docu mixup -- panic conditions are the opposite of what is documented
feat: add status code reason to status codes
body:
# Changes

 * Add reason to status code debug output.

title: feat: improve error messages
body:
# Changes

 * Asserts now include method and url.
 * Standardised text for many responses.

title: feat: add pretty assertions
body:
# Changes

 * Fix expected to be on the left of the assertions provided.
 * Add support to use pretty_assertions crate.

title: feat: add TestResponse::assert_status_forbidden
body:
# Changes

 * Add `TestResponse::assert_status_forbidden` method.

title: chore: bump cargo version
body:
# Changes

 * Bump for releasing docs readme change.

title: Docs readme
body:
# Changes

 * Fix incorrectly rendered heading on crates io.

title: refactor: fix typo in test name
body:
# Changes

 * Fix a typo in a test name.

title: feat: mock http
body:
# Changes

This is a large rewrite of how requests are sent and handled. This adds the concept of `TransportLayer`, which allows multiple implementations.

This includes an implementation for a random HTTP port, a named HTTP port, and a mock transport layer using Tower Oneshot.

title: Fix readme
body:
# Changes

 * fix incorrect import in README.md

title: feat: TryFrom<TestRequest> for http::Request
body:
# Changes

 * Add `TryFrom<TestRequest>` to convert into a `http::Request`.

title: refactor: reduce port reserving
body:
# Changes

 * Move port reservation out to `reserve-port`

# Comments

The `reserve-port` crate now tries to use ports from 8xxx onwards, instead of 10xxx. Which should create less alerts on MacOS on if you should run the tests.

title: feat: server expect success and failure
body:
# Changes

 * add `TestServer::expect_success()`
 * add `TestServer::expect_failure()`

# Comments

This adds two functions to the `TestServer` which are present in the config, and the `TestRequest`. It is to make the API more uniform.

title: feat: TestServer header additions
body:
This will be released as version 12.

# Changes

 * Change `TestServer::server_address()` to include the scheme in what is returned.
 * Change `TestResponse::request_url()` to return a `Url` over an `&str`.
 * Add `TestServer::add_query_params()`
 * Add `TestServer::add_header()`
 * Add `TestServer::clear_headers()`
 * Update dependencies.

# Comments

This is a large update to get this to a complete state for now. It brings feature parity between the `TestServer` and `TestRequest`, reorganises some tests so it's easier, uses `Url` over strings where possible, and updates dependencies.

title: feat: improve port reserving
body:
# Changes

 * Can now reserve custom ports provided by the user.

# Comments

This simplifies the port reservation logic.

title: Docs adjust links
body:
# Changes

 * Make doc links shorter and more readable.
 * Update documentation on fail fast behaviour.

title: fix: reserve ports whilst the TestServer is running
body:
# Changes

 * reserve ports whilst in use.

# Comments

Fixes a bug where two ports can sometimes be picked at the same time.

title: change: default expect failure
body:
# Changes

 * The `TestRequest` failure expectation behaviour is now disabled by default.
 * Expect success behaviour can now be turned through the `TestServerConfig`

title: chore: improve docs
body:
# Changes

 * Improve documentation across the whole project.

# Comments

This is a big revamp of the documentation, including lots of additional code samples.

title: refactor: change deserialize requirements to deserializeowned
body:
# Changes

 * Change to use `DeserializeOwned` over `for<'a>` requirements

# Comments

There should be no real difference here. The change is done to make the code slightly more readable.

title: feat: change bytes conversions for response
body:
# Changes

 * `TestResponse::bytes` is changed to `TestResponse::as_bytes`, and returns `bytes::Bytes` over `&[u8]`.
 * Add `TestResponse::into_bytes`
 * Add `From` definition for converting `TestResponse` into `Bytes`

# Comments

This is a bunch of breaking changes to improve the bytes conversions for the response.
One can now chose to consume or borrow the underlying bytes, and it's been changed from a `u8` slice to a `Bytes` object.

title: feat: TestResponse::assert_form
body:
# Changes

 * add `TestResponse::assert_form`
 * add tests for `TestResponse::assert_json`

# Comments

Adding `assert_form` for completeness, and tests are good.

title: feat: TestResponse::form
body:
# Changes

 * Add `TestResponse::form`
 * Add tests for `TestResponse::json` and `TestResponse::text`.

title: feat: add form upload
body:
# Changes

 * Add `TestRequest::form`.
 * Simplify content type setting on `TestRequest::form`, `TestRequest::text`, and `TestRequest::json`.

# Comments

The content type was changed on the handlers to just set the content type, instead of trying to be clever and predict the content type to use.

This is to make the library more predictable for the end user.

title: Feat query params
body:
# Changes

 * Add `TestRequest::add_query_params`
 * Add `TestRequest::add_query_param`
 * Add `TestRequest::clear_query_params`
 * Add `TestServer::add_query_params`
 * Add `TestServer::add_query_param`
 * Add `TestServer::clear_query_params`

# Comments

Adds the ability to send query parameters.

title: Feat http requests
body:
# Changes

 * Allow requests that include the full http schema, to bypass the TestServer.

# Comments

This is needed for a real world E2E test.

title: fix: better error messages for status code failure
body:
# Changes

 * Improve the error message for assert_status_success and assert_status_failure.

title: Version 9.1.0 release
body:
# Changes

 * add sync to fix header tests
 * move add_header tests into TestRequest
 * add test for clear_headers

# Comments

Big thanks to @ricerca1-itg!

title: Added support for adding arbitrary header to a `TestRequest`
body:
# Changes

 * Added builder methods `add_header` and `clear_headers` to the struct `TestRequest`

# Comments

Fixes #12 
In case of duplicate headers (e.g. setting the `content-type`) the last ones take precedence. I think this is the less surprising outcome, although maybe it is better to substitute `TestRequest.headers` with some map.

title: fix: 200 fail status
body:
# Changes

 * Change default expect behaviour to expect 2xx range or not, rather than 200 alone.
 * Add `#[track_caller]` to assert functions.

title: feat: add means for building using IntoMakeServiceWithConnectInfo
body:
# Changes

 * Refactor `TestServer` to take something that implements `IntoTestServerThread`.
 * Add `IntoTestServerThread` type for modelling how to build from `IntoMakeService` and `IntoMakeServiceWithConnectInfo`.

title: assert methods take self by reference
body:
Implements the change as described in https://github.com/JosephLenton/axum-test/issues/7

Will conflict somewhat with https://github.com/JosephLenton/axum-test/pull/8, but opening now as a proof-of-concept.

Closes #7

title: fix: windows support
body:
# Changes

 * Change default IP address from `0.0.0.0` to `127.0.0.1`.
 * Add means to change defautt IP.
 * Add means to change default Port.
 * Remove default socket address.
 * Bump to version 8.

# Comments

This fixes Windows support, and if needed by the user, gives the ability to set _only_ the IP to use.

title: refactor: server's internal state
body:
# Changes

 * Change internal state to only contain what is shared, the cookies.
 * Change `TestServer::server_address` to no longer return the protocol.

# Comments

This moves a lot of the internal logic out of the inner test server and back into the TestServer. Where it's much easier to work with, without an `Arc` + `Mutex` in the way.
